testcase.name: App initializing
testcase.summary: Check response in charles after App initialize

step.actions:
1)Install the App on iOS device and set charles Proxy.  
2)Enter the Placement id's.
3)Initialize the SDK.
4)Observe the charles.
step.expectedresults:
1. App should get initialized.
  2. Config API should get called.
  3. SDK should download an Ad for the placement id when auto cache flag is enabled.

testcase.name: Ad Unit Caching
testcase.summary: Check caching of multiple Ad's

step.actions:
1)Install the App on iOS device and set charles Proxy.  
2)Enter the Placement id's.
3)Initialize the SDK.
4)Observe the charles. 
5)Play the Ads.
6)Repeat 3,4,5
step.expectedresults:
1) SDK should download multiple Ads for all placement id's with respect to placement priority. 
2) If 2 Placements have the same Metadata the Ad should not be downloaded twice.
3) If an Ad is already downloaded and if the App tries to download an Ad with same meta data, the SDK should use the Cached Ad and not download again.
4) Based on the Auto Cache Flag in the test app, The ad for the particular placement id will be downloaded automatically.
 
Note:- 
This will happen only when Metadata for 2 Ad's is the same

testcase.name: Ad Unit Caching for corresponding placement ID
testcase.summary: Check caching of  Ad for corresponding placement ID

step.actions:
1)Install the App on Android/iOS device and set charles Proxy.  
2)Enter multiple valid  Placement id's and active all entered ID'S .
3)Manually initialise the App
4)Tap on download button in front of placement ID for caching Ad to it.
5)Observe the Charles.
step.expectedresults:
1. Ad should download for corresponding placement ID.
2. Ad should play normally on device.

testcase.name: Manipulate the "sleep" parameter value in response of ads
testcase.summary: check Manipulate the "sleep" parameter value in response of ads

step.actions:
1) Map ads response with sleep response.
2) Initialize app
3) Observe Ads API call in Charles
step.expectedresults: The SDK should wait the amount of sleep seconds specified by the server

step.actions:
Enter:
AppID: 595d73ee3087f51025000040
Placements: DEFAULT63909, GOSLEEP27738, MRAID0058210
 
Steps:
1. Launch the test app
2. LoadAd for sleep placement id (this gets sleep response)
3. LoadAd for sleep placement id
step.expectedresults:
1) Sleep on ads response should affect only on the specific placement for that duration.
2) Except the Placement that got sleep, SDK should be able to prepare ads for other Placements.
3) For any sleep response SDK should return Ad Unavailable for that Placement.
4) Sleep for auto cached ads on expiration, should resume preparation of ad.
5) Sleep for non auto cached ad should not resume preparation of ad automatically.
6) On context switching to other apps, or even in case of forced stop or kill the app, on resuming or re initialisation of SDK should Honor any existing sleep for Placements.

step.actions:
1) Map ads response with sleep response.
2) Initialize app
3) Observe Ads API call in Charles.
4)Sleep responce is recive.
5)After this remove map ads response.
6)Observe the charles fopr ads response.
step.expectedresults:
1)Sleep for auto cached ads on expiration, should resume preparation of ad
 
2)Vaild ads response should recive and ad should play normally.

testcase.name: Close button behavior for MRAID video
testcase.summary: Based on "INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" and "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" parameter value, the SDK should behave accordingly
testcase.preconditions:
1. Set Charles proxy.
  2. Initialise the App 
  3. play ad
  4. Observe the Charles.

step.actions: 1)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5", 2)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "5", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", 3)"INCENTIVIZED_CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS": "9999", set thees value in Ads response API
step.expectedresults: 1) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is 5. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button. 2) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is skippable close button; otherwise, it should delay for 5 seconds. 3) This case, when it's not incentivized, it should use the "CLOSE_BUTTON_DELAY_SECONDS" value, which is 9999 which is skippable close button.. if it's incentivized, use 9999, which is skippable close button.

testcase.name: Broken point- when "MP4" assets are broken

2)Prepare "Ad" response with manipulated "url" to point to the asser you prepared in #1.
3)Start Test app
4)Map "Ad" API call to local or your remote server with CharlesProxy to return the response
5)Check if the SDK behaves accordingly
Test the same thing for "will_play_Ad" case
step.expectedresults: SDK keeps retrying for max of 6 times and the app should not crash.

testcase.name: Flexview Ad Close timer option
testcase.summary: Check for the adDuration parameter of Flexview ad.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Install the App.

â€‹2.Initialise the App

2. Initialise the App.

Header bidding feature will only available on IOS 5.3.1

 

PRD:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CFROBOZQMQqabPbMNQxKC9qLQ0Dz45BSeTAFGXZ4Zoo/edit#heading=h.vstew9ppdi0e

 

 

Tech Design:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YACiXmo58_401HgOjSdoelsvem2HTR8tvvB8k7TAel0/edit

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zkhSLCA3ErQlcQegyhrYGuHu0DgR2i6hqsyu38LGsWM/edit

testcase.name: Header Bidding Enabled
testcase.summary:
Currently, header bidding only available on http://v5e2e.vungle.com

Test should be performed on all ad types.
testcase.preconditions: AppID with local ad placement, fullscreen placement, flexview/flexfeed placement.

step.actions: Request for an ad
step.expectedresults:
/ads response with

"bid_token": base64encode( aes-gcm(key, json.Marshal( {header bidding object} ) ) )

Looks something like this:

""

step.actions: Check the callback log
step.expectedresults: after the ad is successfully prepaired, the callback log wil print out the placement with the last 10 charecters of the bid_token. This token should match the last 10 charecters of the token in the /ads response for that placement.

step.actions:
Charles rewrite /ads

"header_bidding": false,
step.expectedresults: /ads response will NOT include bid_token key

testcase.name: Paying user
testcase.summary: Check the Paying user value
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Enter pub app ID and Placement ID.
2. Initialise the App.
3. Observe Paying user value
step.expectedresults: Paying user value should show either “YES” or “NO”.

testcase.name: Paying user on successul in-app purchase
testcase.summary: Check the Paying user behaviour
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Enter pub app ID and Placement ID.
2. Initialise the App.
3. Load Ad
4. Play Ad
5. Download and Install app from End card
6. Observe Paying user value
step.expectedresults:
The value should be YES if there has been a successful in-app purchase.

Otherwise it should display NO.

testcase.name: Simulate purchase button
testcase.summary: Check Simulate purchase button functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Enter pub app ID and Placement ID.
2. Initialise the App.
3. Tap on Simulate purchase button
step.expectedresults:
On tapping Simulate purchase button should change the Paying user to YES.

When the Paying user value is YES the Simulate purchase button label should change to “Reset”.

When running on an account which supports in-app purchases the button label will be “Purchase” which will begin the in-app purchase process.

testcase.name: Reset button
testcase.summary: Check Reset button functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Enter pub app ID and Placement ID.
2. Initialise the App.
3. Tap on Reset
step.expectedresults: On tapping Reset button should change the Paying user to NO.

testcase.name: Days in app control
testcase.summary: Check the Days in app Increment /decrement
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Install the App
2. Enter the valid Placement id's.
3. Initialise the App.
4. Tap on Increment/Decrement button for Days in app
step.expectedresults:
The increment/decrement control should allow to increment and decrement


"Days in app" should increment the count on tapping Increment button.
"Days in app" should decrement the count on tapping decrement button.

Increment or decrement the count should be independent of all other values.

The value should not decrement below 0.

 

Send LoadAd request
Verify /ads request payload. These values should change accordingly
 
"request": {
"user_app_state": {
"ads_clicked_count": XX,
"days_in_application": XX,
"is_viral_user": true or false,
"consecutive_days_in_application": XX,
"is_paying_user": false or true
},

testcase.summary: Check the Consecutive days in app Increment /decrement

2. Initialise the app.

step.actions:

2. Enter the valid Placement id's.
3. Initialise the App.
4. Tap on Increment/Decrement button for Consecutive days in app
step.expectedresults:
The increment/decrement control should allow to increment and decrement count of Consecutive days.

"Check the Consecutive days in app" should increment the count on tapping Increment button.

"Check the Consecutive days in app" should decrement count on tapping decrement button.

 

Send LoadAd request
Verify /ads request payload. These values should change accordingly
 
"request": {
"user_app_state": {
"ads_clicked_count": XX,
"days_in_application": XX,
"is_viral_user": true or false,
"consecutive_days_in_application": XX,
"is_paying_user": false or true
},

testcase.name: Consecutive days in app Control for last opened date is > 1 day ago
testcase.summary: Check the Consecutive days in app for last opened date is > 1 day ago
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Install the App
2. Enter the valid Placement id's.
3. Initialise the App.
4. Load Ad
5. Play Ad
6. Repeat steps from 3 to 5 for consecutive days
step.expectedresults:
It should reset to 1 if the last opened date is > 1 day ago, and not changed if the last opened date is today.

In normal use this value is incremented if the last opened date is yesterday.

 

 
Verify /ads request payload. These values should change accordingly
 
"request": {
"user_app_state": {
"ads_clicked_count": XX,
"days_in_application": XX,
"is_viral_user": true or false,
"consecutive_days_in_application": XX,
"is_paying_user": false or true
},

testcase.name: Ads clicked control
testcase.summary: Check the Ads clicked Increment /decrement
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Install the App
2. Enter the valid Placement id's.
3. Initialise the App.
4. Load ad
5. Tap on Increment/Decrement button for Ads clicked
step.expectedresults:
The increment/decrement control should allow to increment and decrement the Ads clicks count.

"Ads clicked" should increment on tapping Increment button.

"Ads clicked" should decrement on tapping decrement button.

Increment or decrement the count should be independent of all other values.

The value should not decrement below 0.

 

Verify /ads request payload. These values should change accordingly

"request": {

"user_app_state": {
"ads_clicked_count": 100,
"days_in_application": 100,
"is_viral_user": true,
"consecutive_days_in_application": 100,
"is_paying_user": false
},

testcase.name: Default button
testcase.summary: Check the Default button behaviour
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Install the App
2. Enter the valid Placement id's.
3. Initialise the App.
4. Load ad
5. Tap on Default button
6. Request for an ad
step.expectedresults:
On tapping Default button should only reset the values to the default state as follows:
Paying user - NO
Days in app - 1
Consecutive days in app - 1
Ads clicked - 0
Viral - NO
Last opened date - Today

Default button should affect only the user segmentation data and not other data

 

Verify /ads request payload. These values should change accordingly
 
"request": {
"user_app_state": {
"ads_clicked_count": XX,
"days_in_application": XX,
"is_viral_user": true or false,
"consecutive_days_in_application": XX,
"is_paying_user": false or true
},

testcase.name: Last launch date - Set Date
testcase.summary: Check the Last launch date - Set date in app
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Install the App.
2. Enter the valid Placement id's.
3. Initialise the App.
4. Load ad
5. Tap on Set Date button
step.expectedresults:
User should be able to change Last launch date using the set date button.

On tapping Set Date button should open a selection control to select 0, -1, -2, -3, -4 , or -5.

Set Date should allow date selection only before today's date and today's date

 

 

Verify /ads request payload. These values should change accordingly
 
"request": {
"user_app_state": {
"ads_clicked_count": XX,
"days_in_application": XX,
"is_viral_user": true or false,
"consecutive_days_in_application": XX,
"is_paying_user": false or true
},

testcase.name: Last launch date
testcase.summary: Check the Last launch date update
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install the app.
2. Initialise the app.

step.actions:
1. Install the App
2. Enter the valid Placement id's.
3. Initialise the App.
4. Load ad
5. Play Ad
6. Download and Install app from End card
7. Launch the App
step.expectedresults:
"Last launch date" should be the last date that the application was launched.

If the user launch for the first time then should display yesterday's date.
For example: If user launches the app at 11:00 PM (Jan 15, 2018) and launches next day i.e. after 12:00 AM (Jan 16, 2018), then should display Jan 15, 2018

If the user launch for more than once on same day then should display same day date.

testcase.name: GDPR opted_in Status
testcase.summary: Check for the API calls for opted_in GDPR status

2. Initialize the app.

step.actions:

2. Tap on the More option tab.
3. Select GDPR status as 'opted_in' and checked European override checkbox.
4. Click on SET GDPR Option.
5. Load and play Ad.
step.expectedresults:
1. GDPR parameter should display in Ads and ReportAd API.
2. Consent status should be displayed as 'opted_in' in ads API.
3. Consent popup should not display when user play an Ad.

1. Consent popup should appear on video when user plays an ad.

2. Consent popup should not disappear unless user selects either of the option.

3. I consent popup should contain proper Default values without any truncation issue and spelling mistake issue.
